summary: Joyce Ann Larkin was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears in several payroll certifications and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1978. These documents detail her employment, position, annual salary, and gross pay during her time with the committee. One document specifically focuses on her HSCA staff payroll records, including Payroll Authorization Forms outlining her employment history. Social Security numbers were postponed from release due to privacy concerns.
significance: Joyce Ann Larkin's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, indicating her involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination. The payroll records provide insight into the staffing and financial operations of the committee during its investigation.
